settings.section_dec: Medium Chain Triglycerides are a type of fat derived from coconut oil. They are instantly converted to ketones which is used by the body for long lasting energy. Ketones can pass the blood brain barrier, making it a powerful brain fuel for instant energy and focus.
Acacia fiber is a natural prebiotic fiber derived from the sap of the Acacia tree. It's a powerful superfood that feeds our healthy gut bacteria and supports our bodyies digestive health.

settings.advantages_text: MCT provides instant energy and focus when you need to get shit done!
MCT is instantly converted to energy and because its a fat it lasts longer than carbs.
MCT increases satiety and fatburn and help reduce cravings between meals.
Get the most out of your day without energy crashes or hunger pangs.

settings.benifits_subtext: Only MCT-oil and acacia fiber. That's it. No fillers or junk additives.
Acacia fiber is a natural prebiotic fiber that feeds our friendly gut bacteria.
C8 is the holy grail of MCT’s. We extract it from coconut, no palm oil in sight.
Makes the coffee creamy and smooth without the need of a mixer

settings.section_text: MCT stands for Medium Chain Triglycerides which are fatty acids derived mainly from coconut oil. MCT’s are shorter in length than most other fats and can therefore take a shortcut in the body and instantly be used as powerful energy.
...and get shit dome! Wake your brain in the morning by adding MCT to your coffee or tea and get the most out of your day.
Feeling tired in the afternoons? MCT gives you instant energy and keeps your blood sugar stable. No more yawning in the office!
Never feeling really satisfied? MCT makes you feeling full for longer and help you resist the constant urge to snack!
MCT gives you instant but also long lasting energy to crush it at the gym! It’s especially powerful for endurance sports like running and cycling.

settings.section_title: Mix in your coffee or tea..

settings.section_text:
MCT stands for Medium Chain Triglycerides which are fatty acids derived mainly from coconut oil. MCT’s are shorter in lenght than most other fats and therefore takes a shortcut in the body.


Because of this, the body can turn MCT into energy far more quickly and through a totally different pathway, compared to other types of fats.

Ketones are a powerful fuel for your body that will instantly improve energy, increase fat burn, reduce cravings and improve your mental performance and focus.

MCT’s are often used by athletes who needs instant and sustained energy to boost their performance and improve endurance during a tough workout. MCT’s are also very helpful for weight loss, assisting to keep blood sugar levels stable and control appetite by increasing the feeling of fullness. MCT-oil also improves gut health and reduces inflammation.

Acacia is a natural prebiotic fiber derived from the sap of the Acacia tree. It's a powerful superfood  that feeds our healthy gut bacteria and supports your body's digestive health, which is the foundation of a healthy body.


Acacia fiber is great to include in your diet for many everyday health benefits. Especially to promote a healthy microbiome

Your microbiome (gut bacteria) is the trillions of live bacteria living in your body and these organisms are crucial to our overall health. Researcher are starting to understand just how much of our health is starting in the gut and how important it is to keep it healthy and flourishing.

Our Microbiome can be compared to a garden where the beautiful flowers are the good bacteria and the weed is the bad bacteria. To stay healthy we need to grow the flowers and minimize the weed. To grow our healthy bacterias in the gut we need to give them plenty of nourishing food (prebiotics=soluble fibers) and Acacia fiber is the holy grail of prebiotics.

settings.section_title: Can I use MCT even if I'm not doing Keto?
settings.section_text: Yes you can. But as MCT increases the ketone levels in the body it is extra helpful for those who are following the keto diet, as ketones are their primary source of fuel. But no matter if you're following the keto diet or not you will still benefit from using MCT, as ketones are a powerful source of fuel for everyone.
Start with 1 scoop a day if you’re new to MCT and increase gradually to 2-3 scoops daily for optimal results. Larger amounts can have laxative effects, especially if you take it on an empty stomach.

settings.section_title: What is the difference between MCT-oil and MCT-powder?
settings.section_text: MCT-powder has the same effect as MCT-oil but is easier for the stomach to digest and is more practical to mix in your coffee without the need of a mixer, plus it's easy to bring in the go!

settings.section_title: What is the difference between coconut oil and MCT?
settings.section_text: Regular coconut oil consists of several types of fatty acids with different lengths, but mostly longer chain fatty acids which are absorbed more slowly in the body and can't be used for instant energy. There are four types of MCT's (medium length fatty acids) in coconut oil. The composition looks like this: - Caproic acid (C6): <3% - Caprylic Acid (C8): 6% - Capric Acid (C10): 9% - Lauric Acid (C12): +50% We have extracted C8 (caprylic acid) because it's the most powerful fatty acid because if its quick absorption and instantly converts to energy. There are 6% C8 MCT in coconut oil compared to 100% C8 in the MCT-oil we use.
